trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of links within a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> class stores the link displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control.
Each item in the collection is an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> class, which defines the information of the link.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Add%2A> method provides the ability to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> to the collection.

To remove links, you can use either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Remove%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method if you know where the link is located within the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Clear%2A> method enables you to remove all links from the collection instead of using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a single link at a time.
In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing items, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> also provides methods to find links within the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the link is located within the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the link is located within the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection"></xref> class.
An instance of this class cannot be created without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel"></xref> control that owns the collection.
Adds a link with the specified value to the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link"></xref> representing the link to add.
The zero-based index where the link specified by the value parameter is located in the collection.
Adds a link to the collection.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control can display multiple links within the text of the control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Add%2A> method enables you to convert text within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control to a link that can be clicked on by the user to perform tasks similar to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control.
This method adds the link that is created to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel>.

For example, if you want to set the word "quick" in the label text, "The quick brown fox", you call this method with the `start` parameter set to the value of four (4), and the `length` parameter to five (5).
The word "quick" then changes to a link and the link is added to the collection.

If you want to associate information with the link, such as the URL to display or a file to open when the user clicks on the link, use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Add%2A> method.
Two links cannot share the same text.
If you create a link that uses text that is already used by another link, an exception is thrown.
The starting character within the text of the label where the link is created.
The number of characters after the starting character to include in the link text.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link"></xref> representing the link that was created and added to the collection.
Adds a link to the collection with information to associate with the link.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control can display multiple links within the text of the control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Add%2A> method enables you to convert text within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control to a link that can be clicked on by the user to perform tasks similar to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Button> control.
This method adds the link that is created to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel>.

For example, if you want to set the word "quick" in the label text, "The quick brown fox", you call this method with the `start` parameter set to the value of four (4), and the `length` parameter to five (5).
The word "quick" then changes to a link and the link is added to the collection.
This version of the Add method enables you to provide additional information that can be associated with the link through the `linkData` parameter.
For example, you can pass a <xref:System.String> to the `linkData` parameter that contains a URL to display when the link is clicked.

You can then use this information in your handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkClicked> event of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control to display the URL in Microsoft Internet Explorer.
Two links cannot share the same text.
If you create a link that uses text that is already used by another link, an exception is thrown.
The starting character within the text of the label where the link is created.
The number of characters after the starting character to include in the link text.
The object containing the information to associate with the link.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link"></xref> representing the link that was created and added to the collection.
Clears all links from the collection.
When you remove links from the collection, all information about the removed links is deleted.

To remove a single link from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
Determines whether the specified link is within the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the link is located within the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the link is located within the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link"></xref> representing the link to search for in the collection.
`true` if the specified link is within the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the collection contains a link with the specified key.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.ContainsKey%2A> returns `false`.
The link to search for in the collection.
`true` if the collection contains an item with the specified key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of links in the collection.
This property enables you to determine the number of links in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel> control.
You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.
The number of links in the collection.
Returns an enumerator to use to iterate through the link collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the link collection.
Returns the index of the specified link within the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.IndexOf%2A> method enables you to determine where a link is located within the collection.
To determine if a link is located within the collection before calling this method, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Contains%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link"></xref> representing the link to search for in the collection.
The zero-based index where the link is located within the collection; otherwise, negative one (-1).
Retrieves the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified key within the entire collection.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.
The key to search the collection for.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the entire collection, if found; otherwise, -1.
Gets a value indicating whether this collection is read-only.
This property is always `false` for this collection.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a link with the specified key from the collection.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Item%2A> returns `null.`
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection>.
The name of the link to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link"></xref> with the specified key within the collection.
Gets and sets the link at the specified index within the collection.
You can use this method to obtain the link stored at a specific location within the collection.
To determine the index of a specific item within the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
The index of the link in the collection to get.
An object representing the link located at the specified index within the collection.
The value of index is a negative value or greater than the number of items in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether links have been added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection"></xref>.
`true` if links have been added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Removes the specified link from the collection.
When you remove a link from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.
All information about the removed item is deleted.
You can use this method to remove a specific link from the collection by specifying the actual item to remove from the collection.
To specify the index of the link to remove instead of the link itself, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
To remove all links from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Clear%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link"></xref> that represents the link to remove from the collection.
Removes a link at a specified location within the collection.
When you remove a link from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent items in the collection.
All information about the deleted link is lost.
You can use this method to remove a specific link from the collection by specifying the index of the link to remove from the collection.
To specify the link to remove instead of the index to the link, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To remove all links from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The zero-based index of the item to remove from the collection.
The value of index is a negative value or greater than the number of items in the collection.
Removes the link with the specified key.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.Link> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
The key of the link to remove.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The index of the link parameter, if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to insert into the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see .<xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabel.LinkCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
